CatDescriptText: Walter Jackson, business college student, 311 Larimer Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "I am for the raising of the sales tax because with such a device the state is going to get the money as the people make their purchases.  And another reason is that there is too much being taken now in income taxes."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Walter Jackson wearing eyeglasses, dark hat, and light colored fleece jacket, standing in front of Bud Saunders Flowers in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
